security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files providing technical guidance for Payload CMS development. No executable code, network operations, file system access patterns, or credential handling detected. Content is purely educational reference material covering collections, fields, hooks, access control, queries, and plugin development.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS applications with expert guidance
content.value_statement: Developing Payload CMS applications requires understanding complex patterns for collections, hooks, and access control. This skill provides comprehensive reference documentation to help you build secure, scalable CMS solutions faster.
actual_capabilities: Configure Payload collections with authentication, uploads, versioning, and drafts
Implement field types including relationships, blocks, arrays, and geolocation
Create secure access control patterns with role-based and row-level security
Build hooks for validation, data transformation, and side effects
Query data using Local API, REST, and GraphQL with proper transaction handling
Develop Payload plugins with custom fields, endpoints, and admin components
limitations: Does not execute Payload CMS code or manage databases directly
Cannot access your running Payload instance or production data
Requires Payload CMS version 3.0 or later for all documented patterns
Plugin examples use TypeScript and may need adaptation for JavaScript projects

output_examples.input: How do I create a collection with draft and publish workflow?
output: Add versions config with drafts enabled to your collection
The _status field is automatically added with values: draft, published, changed
Use draft: true parameter when creating or querying to work with draft content
Public access control should filter by _status equals published
Optional: Enable autosave and schedulePublish for enhanced editing experience

best_practices: Always pass req parameter to nested operations in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess: false when passing a user parameter to Local API operations
Use context flags to prevent infinite loops when hooks trigger operations on the same collection
anti_patterns: Passing user to Local API without overrideAccess: false bypasses all access control
Nested operations in hooks without req parameter break transaction rollback on errors
Updating documents in afterChange hooks without context guards causes infinite recursion

faq.question: Which Payload CMS versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill covers Payload CMS version 3.0 and later, which is built on Next.js and uses React Server Components for the admin UI.

faq.question: What are the query limits for the Local API?
faq.answer: Local API has no built-in limits. Set limit and depth parameters to control response size. Use pagination for large datasets.

faq.question: How do I integrate Payload with my Next.js app?
faq.answer: Payload 3.x installs directly in your Next.js app folder. Use getPayload with config import in API routes and Server Components.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. It cannot access your database, files, or running Payload instance.

faq.question: Why is my access control not working in Local API?
faq.answer: Local API bypasses access control by default. Add overrideAccess: false when passing a user parameter to enforce permissions.

faq.question: How does this compare to official Payload docs?
faq.answer: This skill is optimized for AI assistants with quick reference tables, code patterns, and common pitfalls highlighted.
